New Records: Craig Bellamy secured his first win as Wales manager in challenging conditions.
Key Match Events: Wales scored twice in the first 25 minutes with goals from Kieffer Moore and Harry Wilson.
Montenegro's Driton Camaj scored the only goal for the hosts in the 73rd minute.
Wales debutant Karl Darlow made several crucial saves, including a double save that preserved the lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was moved from Podgorica to Niksic due to concerns over the pitch conditions.
Montenegro players were emotional as they paid tribute to their late goalkeeper Matija Sarkic.
Wales manager Craig Bellamy noted the tough conditions and described the win as a battle.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy expressed his pride in the players' resilience and their performance despite the challenging environment.
The victory gave Wales four points from their opening two Nations League matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in extremely challenging weather conditions, with constant rain affecting both teams.
Wales withstood significant pressure from Montenegro, particularly in the second half.
